intro: Lastrea juergensii, commonly known as the red-stemmed groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its striking red stems and yellow flowers make it a visually appealing ornamental plant. It is often cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
